item.title: Genshin Impact Reveals Banner Characters for Version 6.1
item.description:
Genshin Impact has officially confirmed the banner characters for Version 6.1, featuring a strong lineup of Nefer, Furina, Arlecchino, and Zhongli. Version 6.1 is set to introduce the Miliastra Wonderland, a sandbox mode that will allow Genshin Impact players to create, share, and play custom minigames with the rest of the community. However, it will also see the debut of Nefer, and the continuation of the Archon Quest for Nod-Krai.

From a gameplay standpoint, players can expect to see a competitive Dendro hypercarry with Nefer in Genshin Impact . While her potential is deeply tied to Lauma, Nefer's other teammates are highly flexible, with Nahida, Yelan, Xingqiu, Zhongli, Aino, and Baizhu being notable candidates. The bulk of her damage comes from Nefer's enhanced Charged Attacks, strengthened by converting available Dendro Cores on the field into Seeds of Deceit.

Genshin Impact: Event Banners for Version 6.1

First Half

  • Nefer – 5-Star Dendro Catalyst
  • Furina – 5-Star Hydro Sword

Second Half

  • Arlecchino – 5-Star Pyro Polearm
  • Zhongli – 5-Star Geo Polearm

As revealed during the latest developer livestream for Genshin Impact , the Event Banners for Version 6.1 will be Nefer and Furina in the first half, and Arlecchino and Zhongli in the second half. The Weapon Banner for Nefer and Furina will especially be stacked, as their Signature Weapons will be accompanied by a new set of Nod-Krai 4-Stars. In terms of value, players who have chosen not to pursue Lauma will likely benefit the most from obtaining a copy of Furina. Despite Lunar Reactions focusing on Elemental Mastery, Furina remains one of the best Support characters in Genshin Impact .

On the other hand, Arlecchino in Genshin Impact remains a powerful hypercarry in her own right, especially for fans who enjoy her playstyle. Lastly, Zhongli is the epitome of a comfort pick, outclassed by other characters in the majority of premium teams (such as Xilonen), but never outclassed in the category of Shield Supports. The featured 4-Star characters in Version 6.1 are unknown, but datamining has revealed that Lan Yan, Yun Jin, and Rosaria will appear on the banners in one of the halves.

Considering the slate of upcoming 5-Star characters, perhaps the wisest move for Version 6.1 may be to skip the Event Banners and stock up on Primogems in Genshin Impact . According to several sources, Durin is expected to make his playable debut in Version 6.2 as a Pyro Support, while Columbina will join the roster in Version 6.3 as a Hydro Support. Version 6.1 is expected to launch on October 22, and will run until December 3.

236

item.title: GTA 6 Price Concerns Eased by New Survey
item.description:
A new consumer study suggests that Grand Theft Auto 6 would risk leaving money on the table if its entry-level price was above $69.99. The findings ease recent GTA 6 pricing concerns voiced by fans.

As one of the most anticipated video games of all time, GTA 6 has long been expected by some industry watchers to push the boundaries of standard AAA pricing. This perception has fueled speculation of $80 or even $100 price tags, appearing in analyst notes, retailer placeholders, and fan discussions that emerged online since the game's late 2023 reveal.

$70 GTA 6 Launch Would Earn More Than a $100 Sticker, Survey Suggests

Although Take-Two had already signaled that GTA 6 will have multiple editions, some of which are bound to be more expensive than others, concerns about the publisher trying to push the envelope of entry-level pricing may be misplaced. That's the takeaway from a recent study by MIDiA Research, which suggests a $69.99 launch would earn more money than pricing the base game higher. The findings are based on a Gabor–Granger-style survey of over 2,000 U.S. consumers.

The Gabor–Granger Price Analysis Method Explained

The Gabor-Granger method is a straightforward survey technique where respondents are asked whether they would buy a certain product at some realistic price point. Based on binary answers, the researcher then nudges the price up or down as the survey continues, eventually finding the highest price that the majority of respondents are willing to pay. The Gabor-Granger method is a common technique for determining consumer-facing product pricing across many industries.

Based on MIDiA's representative sample data, 59% of U.S. consumers are interested in purchasing Rockstar's upcoming game. "When a title appeals to both core fans and the broader market, companies must strike a careful balance in pricing strategy," explains MIDiA gaming industry analyst Brandon Sutton. Take-Two has thus likely conducted extensive research into potential GTA 6 launch pricing, and if its findings align with MIDiA's, the game is unlikely to debut above the standard $69.99 price point for modern AAA releases.

When a title appeals to both core fans and the broader market, companies must strike a careful balance in pricing strategy.

The possibility of a $69.99 launch mostly aligns with a recent report by leaker Millie A, who claimed GTA 6 would launch in three editions: Standard, Deluxe, and Premium. The same source shared alleged UK pricing, stating the game will start at £69.99, with higher-tier editions priced at £89.99 and £109.99. Early access to GTA 6 Online was the only benefit mentioned for the higher-tier editions, though it likely won’t be the only one—assuming the reported tier structure is accurate. Following its latest delay, Rockstar's much-anticipated title is now scheduled to launch on May 26, 2026. To date, GTA 4 is the only series entry to release in the middle of the year. It might keep that title for a while yet, as recent insider reports suggest another GTA 6 delay that would push it back to late 2026 is not out of the question.

Grand Theft Auto 6

item.title: Zenless Zone Zero Leak Reveals Version 2.4 Characters
item.description:
A new leak from Zenless Zone Zero is teasing two new characters set to join the game's roster during Version 2.4, previously teased during the Version 2.3 Special Program. The HoYoverse urban action RPG has given fans plenty of major characters to pull for during its recent updates, with lots of exciting roster additions. Version 2.2 saw the introduction of two new members of OBOL Squad with Seed and Orphie, while Zenless Zone Zero 's next update will add a trio of characters from the popular Spook Shack faction. Now, recent leaks are hinting at even more new cast members.

Alongside the official reveals for Yidhari, Lucia, and Komano Manato, Zenless Zone Zero showed off a plethora of upcoming roster additions in Version 2.3's Special Program. The brief teaser hinted at multiple new characters from the Waifei Peninsula, giving fans a short glimpse at four new cast members set to join the game soon. HoYoverse has also previously hinted at one of the game's most popular upcoming factions, with Angels of Delusion member Chinatsu appearing during Version 2.1's main event. A new update is now teasing two characters coming in Version 2.4.

Zenless Zone Zero Leak Hints at Version 2.4 Characters

A recent update shared by prominent HoYoverse leaker HxG via fellow leaker Full Stop Chan is teasing two new characters in Zenless Zone Zero 's Version 2.4. According to the post, both Dialyn and Banyue will be joining the playable cast during the Version 2.4 update, said to both be coming to the game as S-Rank characters. HoYoverse has already confirmed Dialyn will be coming as a Physical Stun character, while Banyue's Attribute and Specialty are expected to be revealed within the coming days. Zenless Zone Zero 's Version 2.4 update is expected to launch on November 26.

The addition of Dialyn and Banyue has been confirmed to bring a brand-new faction to Zenless Zone Zero . Dialyn is confirmed to hail from the "Krampus Compliance Authority," serving as a sub-division of the TOPS Group that oversees several major in-universe organizations. The quick release of Dialyn and Banyue after their teasers would also suggest that the other characters featured in Version 2.3's Special Program will not be far behind, with Zhao and Ye Shunguang likely coming in the next few patches.

Zenless Zone Zero fans should have lots to look forward to from the game beyond its new characters during Version 2.3. Zenless Zone Zero will officially add a new skin for Vivian during the update, with players able to acquire the skin after pulling a set number of times from the game's gacha banners. The HoYoverse RPG will also give fans a chance to pick up one of its newest characters for free, with a free copy of Manato available from the "When Dreams Remain Unfinished" event. Zenless Zone Zero 's roster continues to grow even larger with plenty of exciting additions coming soon.

item.title: Silent Hill 2 Remake DLC May Not Be Coming After All
item.description:
A potential DLC expansion for the 2024 remake of Silent Hill 2 that had been teased earlier in the year may not be coming, at least anytime soon, based on commentary from a voice actor who seems essential to its creation. Many fans have been expecting the Born From a Wish side story to be added to Silent Hill 2 for a few months now, and it seems likely that they're in for disappointing news.

Providing a new edition of the classic horror game that keeps its original story intact, Silent Hill 2 's remake was released on October 8, 2024. With the creative team celebrating the game's first anniversary just a few days ago, fans discovered that the Silent Hill 2 website had hinted at more potential versions of the game on the way, and many seemed to be hoping that the long-lost side story would be making a return.

Silent Hill 2's Born From a Wish DLC May Not Be Coming to the Remake

In early June, reputable leaker Dusk Golem broke news about the Silent Hill 2 remake's DLC, stating that, to the best of their knowledge, Konami and Bloober Team were planning to release it, and that its official announcement was likely "just around the corner." More than three months have passed since then, and now, voice actor Salóme Gunnarsdóttir has made public comments that indicate that she has no knowledge of the DLC project even happening. During a recent Twitch stream in which she played the game for the first time, the actress who portrays Maria was asked multiple questions about Born From a Wish by fans eager for a status update. Gunnarsdóttir eventually responded by apologizing, explaining she had not recorded any new dialogue for a Silent Hill 2 DLC, and stating that she doesn't know anything else about it.

If her comments are true, it would be very unlikely that the DLC is anywhere near completion, if it is even in the works at all. For the original game, Born From a Wish provided a short parallel Silent Hill 2 story focusing on Maria, which wraps up by coinciding with the main story at the point when she meets the base game's protagonist, James Sunderland. Not originally released as a DLC, Maria's side story was was packed with special editions and re-releases of the game starting in December 2021, when the game was first ported to Xbox.

It is also possible that Gunnarsdóttir was fibbing with the intent of keeping an official announcement under wraps until Bloober Team and Konami are ready to make it. Potential rumors and leaks from voice actors can be a problem in the gaming industry, so if the DLC is being developed and Gunnarsdóttir is aware of it, the creative team's leadership may have given her specific instructions regarding what she's permitted to say about it.

item.title: Magic: The Gathering is Officially Crossing Over With TMNT
item.description:
Wizards of the Coast has officially announced the next "Universes Beyond" crossover coming to Magic: the Gathering , with the card game set to team up with Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles . The massively popular TCG has made waves throughout recent months with its litany of new crossover content coming to the game, often seeing massive success. Final Fantasy served as Magic: the Gathering 's first Standard-legal crossover set, quickly becoming the fastest-selling expansion the game has ever seen. Now, Wizards of the Coast has officially unveiled yet another new crossover set for next year.

2026 looks to be bringing a ton of crossover content for Magic: the Gathering fans to enjoy, recently confirming multiple Universes Beyond sets for next year. Magic: the Gathering announced that it will be returning to Middle-Earth for one of its big new releases next year, with The Hobbit set to receive its own expansion. Wizards of the Coast also teased several new crossovers for 2025, including a Marvel: Super Heroes set and a Star Trek expansion to close out the year. Now, one more big-name collaboration is being added to Magic 's 2026 schedule.

Wizards of the Coast officially unveiled its next big crossover set during New York Comic Con, confirming Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles will be joining the card game's lineup. The reveal showed off several new cards featuring each of the four Turtles and several iconic supporting characters, including April O'Neil, Casey Jones, and main antagonist Shredder. Wizards of the Coast also revealed some of the products that will be coming with Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles , including a new "Pizza Bundle," a set of Commander Decks, and more. Magic 's Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles set is scheduled to officially launch on March 26.

Magic: the Gathering Reveals TMNT Crossover

The introduction of Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles to Magic: the Gathering will not be the first time Wizards of the Coast has partnered up with Nickelodeon. The card game made waves with one of its "Secret Lair" drops earlier this year, adding some exclusive cards based on SpongeBob SquarePants . Magic: the Gathering is also gearing up to launch another new Nickelodeon collaboration next month, with a new Standard-legal Avatar: the Last Airbender expansion.

Magic: the Gathering 's litany of crossover announcements have also seen some news related to more in-universe cards in the near future. Magic: the Gathering has revealed three new in-universe sets to be released in 2026, including returns to popular planes like Lorwyn and Arcavios with "Lorwyn Eclipsed and "Secrets of Strixhaven." Wizards of the Coast has also teased "Reality Fracture" as another new set coming next year, though little has been revealed about the expansion. Magic: the Gathering fans should have lots to look forward to from the card game with a busy 2026 ahead.
